info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:59PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL WASHINGTON...SOUTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY...SOUTHWESTERN WESTMORELAND...EASTERN GREENE...WESTERN FAYETTE AND NORTHEASTERN MONONGALIA COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported a cluster of briefly strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Carnegie to Bentleyville to near Masontown. Movement of all storms in this cluster is southwest at 30 mph. Some of these storms have produced brief rounds of small hail and heavy rain. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, Morgantown, McMurray, Washington, Uniontown, Canonsburg, Gastonville, Baldwin, and Upper St. Clair. This includes the following highways... Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 8 and 11. Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 15 and 44. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 4 and 61. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 62 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
